info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 03 at 7:59PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...RAIN CHANGING TO HEAVY SNOW... HAZARDS...An area of rain changing to heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than one mile and cause slick road conditions. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 757 PM MDT, an area of heavy snow was near Grand Junction moving northeast at 25 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED... This area of heavy snow will remain over mainly rural areas of southern Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus, northwestern Grand and Battlement Mesas, northwestern Uncompahgre Plateau/Dallas Divide, southwestern Debeque to Silt Corridor and Grand Valley Counties. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 1 and 73. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 32 and 44. Colorado 65 between mile markers 46 and 61. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 26. Colorado 141 between mile markers 150 and 162. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this area of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
